Description: Head of Septimius Severus, laureate, right. (obverse)
Fides, draped, standing front, head left, holding Victory on extended right hand and vertical standard in left. (reverse)
State: Associated with: Roman Empire Ancient Greece and Rome: Roman Empire
Curator's comments: Obverse die link with specimen in Budapest with reverse AEQVITAS II.
Bibliographic references: RE5 / Coins of the Roman Empire in the British Museum, vol.V: Pertinax to Elagabalus (327, p.85)
RIC4 / The Roman imperial coinage, vol. 4: Pertinax - Uranius Antonius (349, p.135) (type)
Associated names: Named in inscription & portrayed: Septimius Severus
